sense.name: concluding point of an event
sense.examples: They played better during the last of the season. The film was exciting to the last. Monday was the last we saw of the man. (final moment of seeing him)

sense.name: moment of death
sense.commentary: LAST[+event][+endpoint][+death] Note: a narrow special usage of Sense 1, always implying death
sense.examples: To the last the caught fish struggled for its life. Hospice workers tend to the terminal patients at home to the last. The tycoon should make a will before he breathes his last.

sense.name: final ranking in a sequence
sense.examples: The runner was in the last of the pack. Bob said he is always the last to know the office gossip. In a family of eight children, Mary was the last. That nation is the last among industrialized countries in terms of export volume.

sense.name: remainder of some aggregation
sense.examples: We drank the last of the French wine with dinner last night. Sally said good night to the last of her guests. He is the last of the big spenders. (implies there are none left except for him) They've finally cleaned up the last of the oil spill.

sense.name: cobbler's tool for holding a shoe form on
sense.examples: The cobbler placed the shoe on a last before repairing the sole. The handcrafted boot shop had several cobblers working with lasts.

sense.name: weight measure equal to 4000 pounds
sense.examples: A last of cargo would weigh 4000 pounds.

sense.name: a volume of grain equal to 80 bushels
sense.examples: Each truck carried a last of grain to the refugee camp.
